intro: Libertia pulchella var. pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf liberty lily, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to South America. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and red. The plant typically grows to a height of only 10–15 cm, making it ideal for rock gardens or small spaces. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
